unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Mean Number of Robin's Eggs
question_text:
Researchers have been observing robins' nests for many years to record the number of eggs robins will lay at one time. Shown below is the probability distribution.
Based upon this distribution, what is the mean number of eggs that a robin will lay at one time?
tables:
X (# of eggs)2345
p(X)0.180.410.390.02
